org.synyx.messagesource

Class InitializableMessageSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.context.support.MessageSourceSupport
      • org.springframework.context.support.AbstractMessageSource
        • org.synyx.messagesource.InitializableMessageSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InitializingBean, HierarchicalMessageSource, MessageSource

    public class InitializableMessageSource
extends AbstractMessageSource
implements InitializingBean
    MessageSource implementation that is able to initialize itself using a MessageProvider. This MessageSource is initializable using the initialize()-method. If this is called it uses the set MessageProvider to retrieve all Messages for the set basename at once. This class caches messages and resolving-paths and uses the resolving-strategy also the default ResourceBundle does. When resolving a message the keys are tried to resolve in the following order:
    • given Locales language + country + variant
    • given Locales language + country
    • given Locales language
    • default Locales language + country + variant (property defaultLocale, if not null)
    • default Locales language + country (property defaultLocale, if not null)
    • default Locales language (property defaultLocale, if not null)
    • Default (basename)

    You may set no defaultLocale which leads to resolving without the lines above containing (property defaultLocale, if not null).

    You must set a MessageProvider which gets called to read all the messages at once.

    You may set a basename or a List of basenames explicitly. If you do so this only messages for this basename(s) are resolved (and read from the MessageProvider). If you do not provide a basename all the messages delivered from the MessageProvider are used.

    Author:
    Marc Kannegiesser - kannegiesser@synyx.de

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes messages by retrieving them from the set MessageProvider. This also leads to a reset of the resolving-paths used to cache lookup-paths for messages

      • initialize

        Reads all messages from the MessageProvider for the given Basename.
        Parameters:

      • getDefaultLocale

        public Locale getDefaultLocale()

      • setDefaultLocale

        public void setDefaultLocale(Locale defaultLocale)
        Sets the default Locale used during message-resolving. If for a given Locale the message is not found the message gets looked up for the default-locale. If the message is not found then the "base-message" is used. This is allowed to be null which then means "no default locale"
        Parameters:
        defaultLocale - the Locale to use as default or null if no default-locale should be used

      • setMessageProvider

        public void setMessageProvider(MessageProvider messageProvider)
        Sets the MessageProvider for this which is asked for all its Messages during initialisation.
        Parameters:
        messageProvider - the MessageProvider to use

      • setBasename

        public void setBasename(String basename)
        Sets a single basename for this. This cannot be used in combination with setBasenames(List). If neither setBasename(String) nor setBasenames(List) is called the basenames are looked up from the MessageProvider
        Parameters:
        basename - the single basename to use for this instance

      • setBasenames

        public void setBasenames(List<String> basenames)
        Sets a List of basenames to use for this instance. This cannot be used in combination with setBasename(String). If neither setBasename(String) nor setBasenames(List) is called the basenames are looked up from the MessageProvider
        Parameters:
        basenames - the List of basenames

      • getReturnUnresolvedCode

        public Boolean getReturnUnresolvedCode()
        Returns:

        Default value is false.If message could not be resolved returns null
        if set to true- will return message code if the message could not be resolved

      • setReturnUnresolvedCode

        public void setReturnUnresolvedCode(Boolean returnUnresolvedCode)

        Default value is false.If message could not be resolved returns null
        if set to true- will return message code if the message could not be resolved
